listAsq.title: How Long Does the Foreclosure Process Take in Florida?
listAsq.content: Foreclosure in Florida is a legal process that typically lasts 8 to 12 months, giving you a valuable window to sell my home in Naples before the court finalizes the sale. The process begins when your lender files a lawsuit (lis pendens), but actual sale dates are usually months away. That time can be used to sell your property for cash, avoid a court judgment, and start fresh.
